title: Corrections & Amplifications
text:
---

Hammond, Ind., is a town nearest to the Illinois border. An Exchange article Saturday about Walt Disney Co. Chief Executive Bob Chapek described Hammond as being near the Michigan border.

(See: "EXCHANGE

---

He Got the Keys to the Magic Kingdom -- Just as Covid Moved In

---

Soon after Bob Chapek took over as Disney's CEO, audiences everywhere were stuck inside. His past as a home-entertainment czar with a lucrative string of talking-dog DVDs would come in handy." -- WSJ Feb. 20, 2021)

---

White supremacists in 2017 held a Charlottesville, Va., rally that turned violent. The Keywords column in Saturday's Exchange section incorrectly said 2018.

(See: "EXCHANGE

---

Keywords -- Who Can Say What Online: An Existential Question for Tech

---

Content moderation used to be a question of taste. Now, it can determine a company's survival." -- WSJ Feb. 20, 2021)

---

Notice to readers

Wall Street Journal staff members are working remotely during the pandemic. For the foreseeable future, please send reader comments only by email or phone, using the contacts below, not via U.S. Mail.

---

Readers can alert The Wall Street Journal to any errors in news articles by e-mailing wsjcontact@wsj.com or by calling 888-410-2667.
